Description: Cosmetic-palette of mudstone (greywacke) carved in the shape of a fish with oval body and two carved notches defining the small tail. Face and tail chipped. Not pierced for suspension. Edges taper to fine point.
Curator's comments: Palette type 46M in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921).
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 69, 87)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine
